question: True about isoenzymes is:

options.opc: Same enzyme classification with same umbers

reasoning_chain: CHAIN: Same quaternary structure -> Different distribution in different organs -> Different enzyme classification with same numbers -> Unclear -> 70% CHAIN: Same distribution in different organs -> Same quaternary structure -> Different enzyme classification with same numbers -> Unclear -> 70% CHAIN: Same enzyme classification with same numbers -> Same quaternary structure -> Same distribution in different organs -> Unclear -> 70% CHAIN: Catalyze the same reaction -> Same enzyme classification with same numbers -> Same quaternary structure -> Same distribution in different organs -> 70%
enhanced_information: Isoenzymes with the same enzyme classification have the same quaternary structure and distribution in different organs. This is supported by the evidence that enzymes are located in specific organs. However, isoenzymes with the same classification may catalyze different reactions, so the statement that they catalyze the same reaction is not always true.
analysis: Isoenzymes with the same enzyme classification do have the same quaternary structure and distribution in different organs. While they may have the same numbers in their classification, they may not necessarily catalyze the same reaction. Therefore, the statement that they catalyze the same reaction is not always true.
